MasterAnswered on 20 Sep 2018Is there a reason why that 1% is attractive enough to risk late payment penalty and interest?Never follow what your peers are doing without thinking thru what is the best options for urself.Usually credit cards needs a required spending amount to get annual waiver if is the free period is over.As a NSF/Students without good consistent income, spending should not be the focus which credit cards allows u to possibly spend over the amount of savings you really have in ur bank account.Go for Debit Card that gives at least 5% cash back which is still currently available in the market.Hope this reply helps.If you feel this reply have Quality, please upvote and check other Quality Reply.https://seedly.sg/profile/kenichi-xiThank you.0 comments2
